attributes.action: Protect Our Countryside and Our Farmland in the Planning and Infrastructure Bill
attributes.additional_details: Removing Amendment 40 leaves our countryside exposed to avoidable harm. Productive farmland is already under pressure from large-scale industrial developments, and this change weakens vital safeguards. Restoring Amendment 40 would protect nature, food security and rural communities by ensuring environmental damage cannot be justified for financial gain.
attributes.background: Lords Amendment 40 ensured Environmental Delivery Plans cannot justify harm to habitats, wildlife or productive farmland. Environmental groups backed it because it prevented damage being traded for financial payments.”

rejection.details:
This Bill has now concluded its progress through Parliament and is awaiting Royal Assent.

You can submit a new petition setting out what changes to the law you would like to see.
